thread.title: Journalist Tries To Prove Trump Racist Because of This… There’s Just 1 Problem, Bill Clinton Did It, Too
thread.title_full: Journalist Tries To Prove Trump Racist Because of This… There’s Just 1 Problem, Bill Clinton Did It, Too

author: Norvell Rose
title: Journalist Tries To Prove Trump Racist Because of This… There’s Just 1 Problem, Bill Clinton Did It, Too
text:
Dems Show Their True Colors With SICK Move They’ve Prepared For Trump: ‘Any Attempt…’ 
It’s anyone’s guess how long liberals and their dutiful minions in the media will keep hurling charges of racism — direct as well as indirect accusations — against Donald Trump in hopes that something will stick long enough to sully his presidency. 
My guess is that the “R-word” will find its way into descriptions of Trump and his agenda for years to come, even when the expression of the accusation is crafted in such a way as to suggest a sophisticated understanding of subtle dog whistles and coded language. 
On the CBS News Sunday show “Face the Nation,” NPR’s Michele Norris tried to dissect Trump’s campaign promise to “Make America Great Again,” and in the process she claimed that embedded in that slogan is a threat to people of color because it talks about “white prosperity.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Norris actually claimed that minorities should be concerned, “Because you’re talking about going back to a time that was not very comfortable for people of color. They did not have opportunities, they were relegated to the back of the line.” 
Okay, well, if that reasoning holds any water whatsoever, why didn’t the left and the likes of the liberal “code breaker” Michele Norris suggest that former president Bill Clinton was wading into a racist swampland when he used the exact words “make American great again” in campaigning for Hillary to get the Democrat nomination back in 2008? 
Wasn’t Bill Clinton heralded as the “first black president?” Why, yes he was, declared so by African-American author and Nobel Prize winner Toni Morrison. 
Yet, Clinton himself said more than once during the 2008 Democrat primary that people should vote for Hillary over the upstart Barack Obama because “It’s time for another comeback. Time to make America great again.” Advertisement - story continues below
